claim: In the U.K., you can protect yourself against claims of copyright infringement by not making any money off the copyrighted work.

supporting.text: Under U.K. copyright law, infringement occurs when a substantial part of a copyrighted work is used without permission, regardless of whether the user profits from it.

attacks.text: Under U.K. copyright law, infringement occurs when a substantial part of a copyrighted work is used without permission, regardless of whether the user profits from it.

supporting.text: The U.K. Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988 does not exempt non-commercial use from constituting copyright infringement.

attacks.text: The U.K. Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988 does not exempt non-commercial use from constituting copyright infringement.
